meanings.definition: A person or thing that voids or nullifies something.
meanings.sent1: The voiders of the contract were the witnesses who saw it being signed.
meanings.sent2: The judge declared the forged signature as the voiders of the will.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child became the voiders of his own promises by constantly breaking them.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp words acted as the voiders of the peaceful atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The storm served as the voiders of any hope for a sunny day at the beach.

meanings.definition: A legal document that cancels or nullifies a previous agreement.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer prepared the voiders for the termination of the contract.
meanings.sent2: The court accepted the voiders submitted by both parties to end the dispute.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected clause in the voiders made everyone laugh during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: The new policy acted as the voiders of the outdated rules in the company.
meanings.sent5: The cancellation email served as the voiders of any confusion regarding the event.

meanings.definition: A type of garment worn to cover or protect the legs.
meanings.sent1: She wore stylish voiders to keep her legs warm in the cold weather.
meanings.sent2: The knight's armor included metal voiders to shield his legs in battle.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer created voiders with a unique pattern that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: The thick voiders acted as a barrier against the prickly bushes in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The athlete wore special voiders to enhance their performance during the race.
